document.docTitle: Hampsonascia dentifascia Volynkin & Černý 2021, comb. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Restoration of the genus Hampsonascia Volynkin (Lepidoptera: Erebidae: Arctiinae: Lithosiini) with descriptions of five new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Restoration of the genus Hampsonascia Volynkin (Lepidoptera: Erebidae: Arctiinae: Lithosiini) with descriptions of five new species

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Altai State University, Lenina Avenue, 61, RF- 656049, Barnaul, Russia

subSubSection.paragraph:
Miltochrista dentifascia Hampson, 1894
,
The Fauna of British India , including Ceylon and Burma
,
2: 108 ( Type locality: [N Myanmar , Shan State , Mong Mit ( Momeik )] “ Momeit , Burma”)
.

Diagnosis . The forewing length is 10–10.5 mm in males and 10.5–11.5 mm in females. The detailed comparison with the similar
H. thaifascia
sp. n.
is provided below in the diagnosis of the latter species.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–8 .
Hampsonascia spp.
: adults. Depositories of the specimens: 1, 2 and 4 in NHMUK (©The Trustees of NHMUK); 3, 5 and 8 in MWM/ZSM (8 ex CAV); 6 and 7 in CKC.

FIGURES 9–16 .
Hampsonascia
(9–14) and
Sesapa
(15–16) spp.: adults. Depositories of the specimens: 9–11, 14 and 16 in MWM/ZSM (11 ex CAV); 12 and 13 in CAV; 15 in NHMUK (©The Trustees of NHMUK).

FIGURES 17–22 .
Sesapa
(17–20) and Longarsine (21, 22) spp.: adults. Depositories of the specimens: 17,18, 21 and 22 in NHMUK (©The Trustees of NHMUK); 19 and 20 in MWM/ZSM.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution . Northeast India ( Meghalaya and Arunachal Pradesh ) ( Hampson 1900 ; Kirti & Singh 2016 ), northern Myanmar ( Shan State ) ( Hampson 1894 ), south-western China ( Xizang ) (
Huang et al. 2021
) and North Thailand ( Chiang Mai Province ) ( Černý & Pinratana 2009 , partim). The records from the Thailand provinces of Lampang , Tak , Sakhon Nakhon and Nakhon Ratchasima by Černý & Pinratana (2009) require clarification. The records from Java and Bali ( Černý & Pinratana 2009 ) probably belong to species of the externally reminiscent
Miltochrista perihaemia Hampson, 1900
species-group.
